snippet: Representative Jean Schmidt’s defeat in the Ohio primary was seen as a warning shot from the Campaign for Primary Accountability.
abstract: Primary defeat of Ohio Rep Jean Schmidt by upstart candidate Brad Wenstrup has illustrated the growing power of super PAC organizations in congressional races and the dire position of many incumbents in the abysmally unpopular House of Representatives; Wenstrup was heavily funded by the Campaign for Primary Accountability, which has targeted several incumbents in both parties.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Representative Jean Schmidt’s defeat in the Ohio primary was seen as a warning shot from the Campaign for Primary Accountability.

headline.seo: Anti-Incumbent Super PAC Adds to Congress’s Insecurity
headline.main: ‘Super PAC’ Increasing Congress’s Sense of Insecurity
headline.print_headline: ‘Super PAC’ Increasing Congress’s Sense of Insecurity

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
